str2: Genitive case of an interrogative pronoun pos otherwise obsolete; as adverb of place; at what locality.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
(a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there. Of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An eagle, bird of prey. From the same as aer; an eagle.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To collect, gather together, assemble. From epi and sunago; to collect upon the same place.
